description: Creates a connector using the specified properties.

parameters.name: capacity
parameters.description: Information about the capacity allocated to the connector. Exactly one of the two properties must be specified. autoScaling (dict) --- Information about the auto scaling parameters for the connector. The maximum number of workers allocated to the connector. The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8. The minimum number of workers allocated to the connector. scaleInPolicy (dict) --- The sacle-in policy for the connector. Specifies the CPU utilization percentage threshold at which you want connector scale in to be triggered. scaleOutPolicy (dict) --- The sacle-out policy for the connector. The CPU utilization percentage threshold at which you want connector scale out to be triggered. provisionedCapacity (dict) --- Details about a fixed capacity allocated to a connector. The number of workers that are allocated to the connector.

nested_params.name: autoScaling
nested_params.description: Information about the auto scaling parameters for the connector.

nested_params.name: maxWorkerCount
nested_params.description: The maximum number of workers allocated to the connector.

nested_params.name: mcuCount
nested_params.description: The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.

nested_params.name: minWorkerCount
nested_params.description: The minimum number of workers allocated to the connector.

nested_params.name: scaleInPolicy
nested_params.description: The sacle-in policy for the connector.

nested_params.name: cpuUtilizationPercentage
nested_params.description: Specifies the CPU utilization percentage threshold at which you want connector scale in to be triggered.

nested_params.name: scaleOutPolicy
nested_params.description: The sacle-out policy for the connector.

nested_params.name: cpuUtilizationPercentage
nested_params.description: The CPU utilization percentage threshold at which you want connector scale out to be triggered.

nested_params.name: provisionedCapacity
nested_params.description: Details about a fixed capacity allocated to a connector.

nested_params.name: mcuCount
nested_params.description: The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.

nested_params.name: workerCount
nested_params.description: The number of workers that are allocated to the connector.

parameters.name: connectorConfiguration
parameters.description: A map of keys to values that represent the configuration for the connector. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: kafkaCluster
parameters.description: Specifies which Apache Kafka cluster to connect to. The Apache Kafka cluster to which the connector is connected. The bootstrap servers of the cluster. Details of an Amazon VPC which has network connectivity to the Apache Kafka cluster. securityGroups (list) --- The security groups for the connector. (string) --- The subnets for the connector. (string) ---

nested_params.name: apacheKafkaCluster
nested_params.description: The Apache Kafka cluster to which the connector is connected.

nested_params.name: bootstrapServers
nested_params.description: The bootstrap servers of the cluster.

nested_params.name: vpc
nested_params.description: Details of an Amazon VPC which has network connectivity to the Apache Kafka cluster.

nested_params.name: securityGroups
nested_params.description: The security groups for the connector.

nested_params.name: subnets
nested_params.description: The subnets for the connector.

parameters.name: kafkaClusterClientAuthentication
parameters.description: Details of the client authentication used by the Apache Kafka cluster. The type of client authentication used to connect to the Apache Kafka cluster. Value NONE means that no client authentication is used.

nested_params.name: authenticationType
nested_params.description: The type of client authentication used to connect to the Apache Kafka cluster. Value NONE means that no client authentication is used.

parameters.name: kafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit
parameters.description: Details of encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster. The type of encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.

nested_params.name: encryptionType
nested_params.description: The type of encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.

parameters.name: kafkaConnectVersion
parameters.description: The version of Kafka Connect. It has to be compatible with both the Apache Kafka cluster's version and the plugins.

parameters.name: logDelivery
parameters.description: Details about log delivery. The workers can send worker logs to different destination types. This configuration specifies the details of these destinations. cloudWatchLogs (dict) --- Details about delivering logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. Whether log delivery to Amazon CloudWatch Logs is enabled. logGroup (string) --- The name of the CloudWatch log group that is the destination for log delivery. firehose (dict) --- Details about delivering logs to Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose. deliveryStream (string) --- The name of the Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream that is the destination for log delivery. Specifies whether connector logs get delivered to Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose. s3 (dict) --- Details about delivering logs to Amazon S3. bucket (string) --- The name of the S3 bucket that is the destination for log delivery. Specifies whether connector logs get sent to the specified Amazon S3 destination. prefix (string) --- The S3 prefix that is the destination for log delivery.

nested_params.name: workerLogDelivery
nested_params.description: The workers can send worker logs to different destination types. This configuration specifies the details of these destinations.

nested_params.name: cloudWatchLogs
nested_params.description: Details about delivering logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.

nested_params.name: enabled
nested_params.description: Whether log delivery to Amazon CloudWatch Logs is enabled.

nested_params.name: logGroup
nested_params.description: The name of the CloudWatch log group that is the destination for log delivery.

nested_params.name: firehose
nested_params.description: Details about delivering logs to Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose.

nested_params.name: deliveryStream
nested_params.description: The name of the Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream that is the destination for log delivery.

nested_params.name: enabled
nested_params.description: Specifies whether connector logs get delivered to Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose.

nested_params.name: s3
nested_params.description: Details about delivering logs to Amazon S3.

nested_params.name: bucket
nested_params.description: The name of the S3 bucket that is the destination for log delivery.

nested_params.name: enabled
nested_params.description: Specifies whether connector logs get sent to the specified Amazon S3 destination.

nested_params.name: prefix
nested_params.description: The S3 prefix that is the destination for log delivery.

parameters.name: plugins
parameters.description: Specifies which plugin to use for the connector. You must specify a single-element list containing one customPlugin object. (dict) --- A plugin is an Amazon Web Services resource that contains the code that defines your connector logic. Details about a custom plugin. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom plugin. The revision of the custom plugin.

nested_params.name: customPlugin
nested_params.description: Details about a custom plugin.

nested_params.name: customPluginArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom plugin.

nested_params.name: revision
nested_params.description: The revision of the custom plugin.

parameters.name: serviceExecutionRoleArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used by the connector to access the Amazon Web Services resources that it needs. The types of resources depends on the logic of the connector. For example, a connector that has Amazon S3 as a destination must have permissions that allow it to write to the S3 destination bucket.

parameters.name: workerConfiguration
parameters.description: Specifies which worker configuration to use with the connector. The revision of the worker configuration. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the worker configuration.

nested_params.name: revision
nested_params.description: The revision of the worker configuration.

nested_params.name: workerConfigurationArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the worker configuration.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: The tags you want to attach to the connector. (string) --- (string) ---

nested_items.name: connectorArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that Amazon assigned to the connector.
